children.subject:
I took 186 with Hellerstein and 61b with Hug, I can say Hellerstein knows what he’s doing and historically, guest lecturers have led to some bad semesters for students.

i would take 186 with Hug regardless because he’s a great teacher and reasonable.

history.content:
Note: I will be following Joe's precedents as closely as possible with regards to grading standards and exam difficulty. 

---------------------------

@9122

Note: I will be following Joe's precedents as closely as possible with regards to grading standards and exam difficulty. 


@9122
Note: I will be following Joe's precedents as closely as possible with regards to grading standards and exam difficulty.

I wanted to take 186 next semester and while it's online, it seems that there has been a change of professors from Hellerstein the past few semesters, to Hug. I was wondering if this would affect the content taught, the structure of the class possibly, and whether anyone else thinks exams would be harder / the grading distribution would be worse given Hug's teaching it (going by his 61B exams lol), and if I should hold out for a semester since it seems to be Hug's first time teaching 186. The obvious downside to this is there's no mention on eecs.berkeley.edu of who's teaching it in the Spring so it could get worse.
